poem:
**Restoration**  

In the quiet snap of pages turning,  
a land reshuffles its cards.  
Lines drawn, adjusted under a fading sun—  
outlines of old arguments,  
ill-fitting, yet carried like heirlooms.  
Promises echo through polished corridors,  
footsteps muffled by carpets woven  
with threads of history and  
a nation's whispered vows.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "All the executive orders Trump has signed so far Donald Trump has signed more than 50 executive orders since returning to the presidency in January, including enacting steep tariffs, ending birthright citizenship, curbing DEI and “gender radicalism” in the military and pardoning January 6 rioters. The US president promised in his inaugural speech that these orders would amount to a “complete restoration of America”. Here’s what to know about the executive orders Trump has signed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
